intro: Adesmia denudata, commonly known as the naked adesmia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its seed pods are usually slender and elongated, containing several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Adesmia denudata is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in regions with low rainfall.
